summary: Email correspondence from attorney David Oscar Markus to Judge Nathan's chambers regarding a government letter filed against him in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. Markus explains he has not entered an appearance in the proceeding and requests his response be filed on the public docket.

persons.context: Judge presiding over United States v. Maxwell case, recipient of the email correspondence.

events.title: Government files letter against David Oscar Markus
events.description: The Government filed a letter directed at attorney David Oscar Markus in the United States v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Markus submits response to court
events.description: David Oscar Markus emails his responsive letter to Judge Nathan's chambers regarding the government's letter, requesting it be filed on the public docket.

keyFacts: Attorney David Oscar Markus was the subject of a government letter filed in the Ghislaine Maxwell case on June 30, 2021.
Markus states he has not entered an appearance in the Maxwell proceeding and is not a member of the Southern District of New York bar.
Markus requests that his emailed response be filed on the public docket by Judge Nathan's chambers.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal procedural matters involving attorneys in the Maxwell case beyond the direct prosecution and defense.
